hi i am a fan of you hello! sorry for my english i am mexican & i only have 13 years,well my question is,wich of your games have the biggest variety of power ups?

The Hello Mario Engine has the most...

If that doesn't count, then Super Mario Dynamo has the most because it forces you to use a different powerup for every level.
How Do I Make Small Mario Duck
Search obj_mario's step event for "//Makes Mario duck", delete "and global.powerup != cs_small", and edit scr_marioduck with his duck sprite.

Your Actually A Really Nice Person
You Should Make Some Proper Documentation For Your Engine!
Like How To Add Functions From Various Mario Games!
How do I make a life meter like the one from mythical mushrooms?
Edit obj_mario's User Defined 0 event to change what happens when Mario is hurt, update the HUD (obj_levelmanager Draw event) to display health, and edit mushrooms to give health.
Ok, and how do you change Mario's jump height and make talking characters like the toads?
How Do I Add A Powerup Animation
And How Do I Add Powerups

Search obj_mario's User Defined 2 event for "//Jump higher if Mario is running", and there are various vspeed = -number lines there you need to change, since the jump height depends on Mario's horizontal speed.

Powerup animation: Depends on what you want.
New powerups: Add a new cs_whatever constant in the macros section, add your sprites into GM:S, add those sprites into all the scripts in the Mario folder, add a new powerup object (No code needed, just set the parent to obj_powerupparent, and give it a sprite), then edit the scripts scr_constant_get_sprite, scr_sprite_get_constant, and scr_sprite_make_object (Follow the pattern). Use "if global.powerup = cs_whatever" to check if the powerup is correct before doing whatever your powerup does. In the room editor, add a new ? block with the creation code "sprout = cs_whatever" to test your new powerup.
Powerup Animation As In When I Touch A Powerup / Get Hurt
You need to pause the game by taking a screenshot and deactivating everything. Look at the pause menu as an example. You can draw the animation on Mario's location while the game is paused.
How do i make all forms walljump

In obj_mario's User Defined 2 event, search for "//Handles checking whether Mario can wall climb or wall jump", and remove the global.powerup checks directly below. Also, make sure Frog Mario has a skid sprite.
what is that music in level 2 of SMB kill bowser?

how do i make a circular collison object
It should already be compatible aside from the old message box and fade scripts, which can be copied from newer versions of my engine.
Add the sprites with precise collision detection, parent the object for the top half of the circle to obj_slopeparent, and the bottom half to obj_solid,
It's a remix of the underground theme.
ok
thanks.

please tell me i'm doing something wrong ;_;

also i'm using gm studio

This might help:https://docs.google.com/doc...
Make sure you replace snd_walljump with snd_[sound your using]

Dear staff of Hello Fangaming,

I got an idea for a new Mario game you from an old game called Infinite Mario Bros. that was created by then future Minecraft developer, Markus “Notch” Persson and it
was made in about 2006. The game was basically a randomly generated Super Mario Bros. game with a random map, enemy placement, etc. but with a limited amount of lives. You can add 1UP mushrooms and secret underground pipes to the generator if you want too ;). I think you've the best chance of making the game worthwhile in the Mario community because of all the amazing features you got in the Hello Mario Engine.

Gameplay Video: https://www.youtube.com/wat...

Sincerely yours,
DoubleLaff

Hoi! This engine really great! But... I dunno how to add screen controls in the game, just i make own SMB episode on android and.. i need one, controls... Plz anyone tell me how to add screen controls!

You can map keyboard key presses to screen touches.
http://docs.yoyogames.com/s...

So let's bring things into both sides of the spectrum.

Mario Editor: A worse version of Super Mario Bros Game Master/Level Master. That's a really sad accomplishment. You could've done so much more with that thing, yet you chose not to. Actually, just read this: https://www.supermariobrosx...

And of course, that message was intentionally abrasive and long for the sake of generating a response.
I liked Game Master/Level Master for what they were, so it's not like I'm out for blood.

Super Mario Dynamo: It's got a putrid green filter and industrialization themes. The former is a bad addition to a game as it makes the game aesthetically ugly (there's ways to have pollution, and then there's plastering a filter on everything), and then we're not even talking about the level design, something that's one of your weakest points in general.

Super Mario Eclipse: It's more puzzle oriented, with a horrific filter that makes it a bit hard to see (and play) the damn game. Then there's the puzzles which involve colors, which, as mediocre that is, is offset by how hard it actually is to see that game. It's a very disorienting experience from an objective standpoint, especially when that filter is put on the entire game. There's a better way to go about multicolor effects, as well. Though I understand that may have been your first foray into shader effects.

A rule of thumb for game design, is that if you're struggling to complete the first world of a video game, that's typically a bad sign. Sure, there's a list of exceptions for less-skilled players, but then when the general audience can't actually do that because of design issues or quirks, that's a badly designed first world. This applies to Super Mario Dynamo. It took me TWO YEARS to complete the first stage of that game. The FIRST stage. There's making a game difficult, and then there's making a game unfair or artificially difficult. Difficulty should flow naturally throughout a game or have some sense of rhythm to it.

And most Mario fangame creators don't exactly know these things, so it's not like you're the odd one out here, there's certainly worse designers out there.

Me personally, I don't care if all of the games use SMB3 graphics; while that does get old with enough repetition, what's more important is that a video game is designed for entertainment. A video game should ideally provide an engaging experience with the consumer in an effort to build loyalty, a fanbase, and expand upon it. I'm not exactly sure where your vision takes you.

--------------

I'm simply stating that you should take the effort to improve your design skills, or try to stop doing all of the work yourself. There's no shame in getting assistance from someone if you feel like it's going to improve the quality of the final product. ****, I'd work with you. I've made a game that got onto Steam somehow.

While it may not be the best idea to listen to 13 year olds about what they want to see in a game, it's typically advised to seek someone who knows their stuff and can provide constructive criticism. I think that's what you're TRYING to get at with your argument against Snessy, but it's rather unclear.

When someone tells you "your game sucks" or "your game isn't good" or "I don't like level 3," these are examples of bad criticism. When someone tells you "you might want to start focusing on levels that keep a sense of engagement with the user, the general progression of a level can be sometimes obtuse in some aspects, with enemy placement that interrupts the pacing of the game," this is something to look at. Especially in large quantities. Subsequently, reviews of your games are always a good place to look for feedback and improvement.

I'm not saying you don't ENTIRELY listen to feedback, but I am saying that you're a little less transparent than you probably should be. I'm sure a lot of people would appreciate if you were more involved with the community, posted updates about your fangaming career, posted things on twitter once in a while, bounced back ideas with some users; it'd lead to better reputation from you, and it'd easily be a way to expand Hello Fangaming.

----------------------------------------

Take a few minutes to read this when you get the chance. As much as I think you're doing things in a very peculiar (and rather destructive) nature, I do want to ensure you perform at the best of your abilities.
A couple of minor issues: the Galoomba (SMW Goomba) seems to be immune to attack when flipped upside-down. Also, Yoshi can't swallow Wigglers, among other things.

To Hello Fangaming...

I have the Open Source Super Mario Bros. 1 Engine you made, and while I was using it, I was running into some issues while using it, I cannot figure out how to do the following:

- Program Mario to allow crouching (As Big or Fire Mario.)

- Adjust the Engine to my sprites' pixel size.

- Program in a shooting animation for Fire Mario.

- Program Mario to Swim.

If you could either remake the engine or give me some help with my issues (which I would actually like more) that wouldn't go unappreciated.

Thank you for reading this message, and for 10 years of making Mario fan-games!

Hello Engine 4 code base is nasty. Adding a powerup to the latest version isn't hard. You just need to copy the sprites over, add a new constant, and just follow the pattern in the scripts in the Mario folder.
I've discontinued those old engines in favor of the Hello Mario Engine, since this engine already has everything, so I recommend using the Hello Mario Engine for your game instead.

Thanks for responding, I have considered moving my work onto the new version of HE, but at the moment (because someone passed me a link to HE4) I'm sticking to the old engine :P but thanks anyways.
And yeah, I noticed that inserting the flaming leaf into the new version isn't that hard.

Oh, just check if Mario's x-coordinate is within 32 pixels to the left of the toad's x, and 32 pixels to the right of the toad's x. If this is case, enable the press-up-to-display-the-dialogue part. Hope this helps! :)

@HelloFangaming:disqus hey, I was wondering if there was a way so that when mario takes damage, he goes down to small size if he has a power up?
You can use the ALT+0 hotkey to disable it. The filtering is handled by obj_persistent, and can be removed by getting rid of the HQ2X and HQ4X shader_set lines.
Edit obj_mario's User Defined 0 event.

Hi Hello Fangaming, I have some ideas for new items and platforms. You should add star coins and red coin rings so it would make the level a lot more fun to get coins and such. You should also make platforms move and swerve (example as in NSMB DS 1-3) and have those bouncy mushrooms and spin platforms (also seen in NSMB DS 1-3). Maybe you could add in those seesaw platforms from NSMB Wii and DS and add in those moving stone platforms from the tower level in the Wii and DS version. And can you also make it so that we can control every side of the level when using SHIFT + ___ to resize a level? Cannons are fun to add too but its optional. I also have another idea. You should add a mini mushroom and allow Mario to go inside the small pipes then the level would be more adventurous, don't you think? (The small bridges in NSMB DS 1-4 only allow mini Mario to go in so maybe add those so big Mario can't enter a mini Mario-only space) Also you should add generators or something like that so enemies can come out of pipes. Maybe the weight/scale platforms in NSMB DS 1-5 too. The tightrope platforms and moving spike platforms in NSMB DS 1-Castle should also be added to.

That's all I have for ideas. What do you think?

You only have to pay once but the FAQ says sadly: no. There isn't. However, unlike some engines such as Construct, you only have to pay for a version of Gamemaker once and you'll always own it. There's a Creator's Edition that's bit less ouch on the wallet if that's a concern.

AKA Put an item in a ? block? Then, rightclick the ? block (or brick if it is supported too) and click "Creation Code". Type "sprout = cs:" (without quotation marks) and you get a list of forms. more bosses, like king bob-om, or something else
also MORE MUSIC
and backgrounds
A Bowser Shroom/Suit, More characters (Luigi, Peach,Bowser,Toad,Wario,Yoshi(with baby mario),and more ), And dont forget costumes!

All I'm going to put in are things that I would like them to add in Mario Editor

I do not want to be demanding, but I would like them to add more powerups, like the Gold Flower (my favorite powerup), the Lightning Flower (my favorite invented powerup), the Metal Shroom, the Giant Shroom, the Boo Shroom and the Cape Feather, as well some bosses more like King Bob-omb, Dry Bowser or Bowsy.

Other things that would be good would be the Star Coins of New Super Mario Bros, the Yoshi Coins of Super Mario World and the Green Stars of Super Mario 3D World, along with the Red Coins with their Ring to activate them and a P-Switch that stops time. Also to add giant enemies and blocks ? giants. Another thing that I think would be good would be the box in which you have the backup object, like Super Mario World.

I would also like the possibility of adding more playable characters, apart from Mario, like Luigi, Toad, Peach and Rosalina. I would also like to make changes in the current powerups, like the Hammer Suit can defeat almost any enemy, I feel it is just as weak as the Fire Flower; that the Ice Flower and the Penguin Suit can throw two ice balls instead of one, an option so that the character that plays can make wall jumps without the Wall Jump Shroom, an option so that the level is snowing, there is a storm of leaves, a sandstorm or fog.

Something that seems original to me of their games and that I would like them to implement in Mario Editor is the option to make the level dark and that only Mario can illuminate it, whether it is light or objects that can maintain the room or zone lit, like torches that are lit or that could be activated with the Fire Flower, Pyre Flower and Gold Flower. Also the blocks of light to illuminate the site and headlights or light bulbs that do the same job of illuminating the place. Also that the Fire Balls, Pyre Balls, Gold Fire Balls and Bombs, both from the game and the Bomb Shroom, along with the Star can illuminate the part of the site they are going.

It would also be good to add more music, but that it was ordered. What I want to say is that the music for the overworlds in one section, the undegrounds in another section, the athetic in another and so, so that they could add music from other games like New Super Mario Bros or Super Mario 64, in addition to the possibility of customizing the autoscroll movement and being able to choose a number of lives in the Challenge Mode.

I would also like the possibility of changing the volume of the music and the sound effects and being able to change the controls of the game. They do not bother me, in fact they are very comfortable, but not everyone shares my opinion.

I see that this game has a lot of potential and I know it is barely in its infancy to include everything I mentioned before, but I would like you to add what you could.
COLD WATER, Xmas Stuff

Hey I have a lot of ideas for Mario editor. I categorized everything.

Backgrounds:

More underground backgrounds

Blocks:

Bomber Brother (Newer Super Mario Bros Wii)

Bone Brother (Like a Dry Bones he can't be destroyed by fire and when stepped he will fall apart and will be put together)
Bone Goomba
Bone Piranha Plant
Dull Bones (Weaker version of Dry Bones that can't put them self together.)
Oily Goomba (Will make the player slip when he jumps on his head. Though this enemy will be very weak against fire attacks and will catch fire.)
Para Brother (Able to come very close to you because of it wings and will throw hammer more rapidly. Wings will be removed when stepped on.)
Peepa (Isn't stopped when the player stares at them)
Sulfer Brother (Throws acid balls that insta kills the player. Only starmans will safe you.)
Sergeantstepper
Shell Brother (Throws koopa shells.)
Shuriken Brother
Soldier Bill (Just a faster version)
Water Brother (Won't hurt the player but instead push them back and has really fast attacks.)

Features:
Rizing Liquids
Poison (Purple/Blue and Green/Yellow Colour)
Vertical Levels
Longer and higher levels
More types of shroom platforms (Colourful)
Big shroom platforms
Tilting shroom platforms (DS)

Debris rain

Starcoins

Dark Levels

Boo Mushroom

Gold Flower
Volt Shroom (My Idea, Gives you the ability to throw lightning that strikes in a arc like the Ice Flower from NSMBW. Strikes disappear after 2 bounces and can electrocute enemies that are really near to it. Weak, metal and electric enemies will be destroyed by this power up like: Bob-ombs,
Chain Chomps , Amps , Goombas , Koopa Troopas and Bullet Bills.)
Blooper Shroom (Custom idea, Turns you into a blooper that can swim a lot smoother than without and bloopers won't harm or chase you. You can squirt ink that can blind enemies. Ink will be fired the same like fire and ice flowers.)
Gold Shroom (NSMB2, gives you 15 coins)

Also, you don't have to remake this if you don't want to. Those are just some ideas that will make Mario Editor even better then it already is.

Put it into your Levels folder, then unzip.

Put a door/warp pipe, on top of it put a text modifier "Destination,Section" (Destination and Section are optional section names.), go to the section the warp will be to, put an exit door/pipe and put a destination modifier (blue text modifier) "Destination" somewhere near.
It does.

Put a door/warp pipe, on top of it put a text modifier "Destination,Section" (Destination and Section are optional section names.), go to the section the warp will be to, put an exit door/pipe and put a destination modifier (blue text modifier) "Destination" somewhere near.

My four years old son, Daniel, is a Super Mario fan, so I decided to create a game for him that was easy but at the same time stimulated his thinking.

Here you can see eight minutes of gameplay: https://www.youtube.com/wat...

Using HelloMarioAssets.

The game is not long; it takes 2-3 hours to finish the five worlds (Forest, Desert, Snowy Mount, Traps, and Pyramid). In each world, you need to collect ten stars and solve two optional challenges/quests. Each world also has a boss to be defeated. The final boss is, of course, the very Bowser who kidnapped Princess Peach.

The game's story is straightforward: Bowser, tired of countless defeats, decides to change strategy and "fires" all his minions, in addition to turning Mario's friends into zombies who become the villain's new allies. In an attempt to return to work for Bowser, his former lackeys (Goombas, Koopas, Piranha Plants, etc.) start helping Mario throughout the game. The boss of each level is, precisely, one of Mario's friends (now turned into a zombie). Each one has its weak point, and to defeat it, you need intelligence and strategy. Players can use coins collected throughout the game to unlock mini-games like Talking Mario and Mario Run, both created by me to my son.

The game is still in development (with Unity) and was created to run on Android mobile devices. That is a platform that lacks the plumber's adventure games. It currently has 270MB in size and runs at 60fps, on average, on a Samsung Galaxy S10+. It can be played in 2 languages: English and Brazilian Portuguese. It uses controls made easier for on-screen play and "haptics feedbacks."

This is a fan-made, non-commercial game.

This framework is absolutely fantastic, there's just one thing that I'd like to know. You see, obviously not everyone is going to be using the Super Mario Bros. 3 based sprites that comes with the framework, I've had a bit of trouble with my project because of an issue that may not have been accounted for. I'm using sprites based on Super Mario World, and the Main issue here is that Small Mario sprites from that particular title are larger than the Small Mario sprites from Super Mario Bros. 3. This is usually the reason why many a user, you can be assured this, have asked about changing the sprite size of Mario, the problem is usually about Small Mario from Super Mario World being too big to fit into the Small Mario sprites section. If there could be either a set list of specific instructions for users that use Super Mario World based Small Mario sprites or even just a Super Mario World based Mario sprite set that would of the utmost helpfulness rest assured. - Harry Hedgehog

SCRATCH THAT, I've just figured it out. In order to use the SMW Small Size Mario you change the Canvas Size to about a Width of 16 and the Height of 24, and have the Origin Changed from 8 by -16 to 8 by -8 you're welcome to the onlookers with the same predicament.
